subtitle: This recipe is an adaptation of a popular Persian dish called Kadu Polo. It consists of layers of rice, lamb patties and pumpkin.

method.text: Mix together the lamb, onion, mint, nutmeg, cinnamon and plenty of seasoning. Divide the mixture into portions (allowing 2 per serving) and shape into small round patties.

Melt the oil and butter together in a frying pan. Fry four patties over a medium heat for 3-4 min or until evenly browned. Remove from pan and drain well on kitchen paper. Repeat with remaining patties.

Place half the cooked rice in the base of a greased ovenproof casserole dish and pour over half the melted butter. Arrange the lamb patties on top and cover with the remaining rice. Top with the chopped squash. Sprinkle with the sugar. Pour over the remaining butter.
Cover the dish with a lid or foil. Cook in the oven for 25-30 min or until piping hot. Serve immediately.

title: Lamb patties with squash and rice
